page.title: 08GOXHILL HALL & PRIORY CONT.
page.content: Once the Graham's took over the properties their first requirement was to put a modern kitchen into the Hall. They later re-roofed the Hall and have conserved the timber panelling of the rooms. As architects they are interested in the history of the properties and found evidence of earlier building when the hall's floorboards were lifted. They also re-excavated much of the moat around the Priory. The moat is water filled and entry to the front of the Hall is by a footbridge. Modern materials have been used in the restoration of the Hall and Priory but the Graham's have also used old second hand bricks. They built a garage entirely from bricks found in the Hall's grounds and in the spoil from the moat's re-excavation. Very few people have a Fortified Manor House in their garden!!
